medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with a palpable thyroid nodule at age 14 years. Initial analysis failed to reveal a mutation, but early presentation of multifocal MTC led to further suspicion of hereditary disease. Observed symptoms included C cell hyperplasia, with progression monitored over the years.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Total thyroidectomy and left modified radical neck dissection in 1967 for multifocal MTC; history of skeletal abnormalities including congenital bowing of the tibia and scoliosis.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of MTC, pheochromocytoma, primary hyperparathyroidism, or skeletal abnormalities noted prior to mutation detection.
